Key Match Events: Venezuela struck twice in the space of 10 minutes in the second half to come from behind and earn a 2-1 victory over Ecuador in the Copa América.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ecuador was reduced to 10 men after Jeremy Sarmiento was given a red card in the 40th minute.
Others: The match was played at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California, with an attendance of 29,864.
The referee for the match was Wilmer Roldán.
